column4: Hi. I have a windows laptop where the entire HD is encrypted with truecrypt. Can I install Ubuntu using the installer in Windows, without having to decrypt/encrypt the drive?
I doubt it will work by default but it can be made to work
vim todo.txt ;)
touch√® :)
What actually happens when  you try to boot windows from grub?
Windows isn't shown in Grub at all. I have to press 'shift' at boot to get the Grub menu.
That solution will not help you then as it's for a different problem.
Is your windows partition encrypted?
no. I have: unencrypted win7, unencrypted /boot, encrypted partition (with /, /home and swap inside).
what is different about the problem in the post except that he installed Windows after Ubuntu whereas I did it the other way around?
the boot flag isn't set for the ntfs-partition on my system either
Does "sudo os-prober" provide any output?
nothing
Are all of your ntfs partitions mountable?
yes.
Could you run boot info script as explained here http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1291280 and pastebin the RESULTS.txt?
http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/4z2cCy4u
You don't have any /bootmgr or /Boot/BCD, which is needed to boot windows.
is that something Ubuntu should have put there? (how) can I remedy it?
No, it's part of Windows. It appears you either have a very odd windows setup or you're missing a partition.
ouch. I had to delete a "system recovery partition" to make room for the other ones I needed. could it be that Dell had put it there?
I think you left the one Dell put there and deleted the one needed by windows.
You're going to need to recreate that partition somehow, it might require re-installing windows entirely. Anyway, this is now a question for ##windows.
